name: SleepRunnable
description: The `SleepRunnable` class is a specialized runnable implementation used within JSMacros for handling delayed or timed script execution. It encapsulates script execution logic that needs to run after a specified delay, enabling asynchronous operations, timed events, and delayed script continuations within the JSMacros scripting environment.
overview:
The `SleepRunnable` class serves as a bridge between JSMacros' synchronous script execution model and asynchronous, timed operations. It provides:

- Delayed execution of script code after specified time periods
- Integration with JSMacros' thread management system
- Safe execution context for delayed operations
- Support for both one-time and recurring delayed tasks
- Proper resource management and cleanup for delayed executions

This class is primarily used internally by JSMacros for operations like `Time.sleep()`, `Time.setTimeout()`, and other timing-related functionality.

constructors.description: Initializes a new SleepRunnable instance with the given script context, delay, and code to be executed. (Conceptual structure; actual implementation is internal).

parameters.name: scriptContext
parameters.description: The script context in which the code will execute.

parameters.name: delay
parameters.description: The delay in milliseconds before the code is executed.

parameters.name: runnableCode
parameters.description: The code to be executed after the delay.

methods.name: run
methods.description: Executes the delayed code within the proper script context. This method is called by the execution framework after the specified delay.
